New Records: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit the game-winning infield single in the 11th inning, securing a 4-3 victory for the New York Yankees over the Kansas City Royals.
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s clutch hit came after Kris Bubic intentionally walked Aaron Judge, and with the infield playing in, Judge advanced to second on defensive indifference.
Luke Weaver earned the victory for the Yankees, while Michael Massey's home run provided a brief lead for the Royals.

The game featured a series of dramatic moments, including Juan Soto's go-ahead home run in the sixth, Salvador Perez's impressive double play, and the Royals' successful challenge of a safe call at first base.
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles' loss to Boston in extra innings allowed the Yankees to maintain their advantage in the AL East, with a 1 1/2 game lead over Baltimore.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees' victory solidified their position in the AL East, while the Royals fell further behind Cleveland in the AL Central but maintained their hold on the second wild card spot.
The Royals will begin a three-game series against the Pittsburgh Pirates after a day off on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first pitch is scheduled for 5:40 PM central time.
Due to Norton High School football coverage Friday, Royals Baseball coverage on SuperStar Country 102.5 & 1530 AM will resume on Saturday.
Others: The Royals have not yet announced their starting pitcher for Friday's game, while Luis L Ortiz is expected to take the mound for the Pirates.
